Default column mapping for raw weather CSVs

Source: R/read_weather_csv.R
default_weather_mapping.Rd

A starter mapping (names = raw headers; values = standardized names) based on Environment Canada daily CSVs. Edit or extend this to match your data source.

Standard target names you can map to: date, station, climate_id, lon, lat, tmax_c, tmin_c, tavg_c, rain_mm, snow_cm, precip_mm, snow_on_ground_cm, wind_spd_kmh, wind_dir_deg, wind_dir_deg10.

Usage

default_weather_mapping()

Value

A named character vector for use in read_weather_csv(mapping = ...).

Examples

default_weather_mapping()
#>                 Date.Time              Station.Name                Climate.ID 
#>                    "date"                 "station"              "climate_id" 
#>             Longitude..x.              Latitude..y.             Max.Temp...C. 
#>                     "lon"                     "lat"                  "tmax_c" 
#>             Min.Temp...C.            Mean.Temp...C.           Total.Rain..mm. 
#>                  "tmin_c"                  "tavg_c"                 "rain_mm" 
#>           Total.Snow..cm.         Total.Precip..mm.         Snow.on.Grnd..cm. 
#>                 "snow_cm"               "precip_mm"       "snow_on_ground_cm" 
#>    Spd.of.Max.Gust..km.h. Dir.of.Max.Gust..10s.deg. 
#>            "wind_spd_kmh"          "wind_dir_deg10"
